pros: Joined the company less than 6 months ago, great company culture. Being part of a company that is being disruptive in the SIEM market is very exciting. Fast paced environment, you are the "quarterback" running your deals. Every person in the company is focused on making sure you are successful and you if you need help to win a deal, they are there. We win together or we lose together. Compensation is good, benefits are competitive, full transparency from leadership. If you have an opportunity to join the company, jump on it.
cons: Not really any cons, as a fast growing pre-IPO company, the pace is fast. If you are waiting around for someone to tell you what to do, this is not the company for you.

review_title: It's a wild ride...probably the most fun I have had in years
pros:
This place is awesome - we are solving a real problem created by legacy SIEM vendors and not only are we helping our clients improve their security posture, but we are helping them save money at the same time.

From the very top down, there is a culture of excitement, passion, transparency, accountability and a shared vision. "That's not my job" are not words ever heard around this place. Everybody is fired up about what we are doing, there is a feeling that we are really making a difference and we are having a lot of fun in the process. That is why I like this size of companies - more than 100 employees, but less than 1,000 - everyone is empowered, there is no place to hide, the pace of the work is exhilirating, no two days are the same and the little speedbumps along the way make the successes that much sweeter.
cons: I wouldn't really call this downside (at least it is not for me), but if you can't handle a bit of chaos, can't think quick on your feet and don't like to work hard, this place may not be for you.
advice_to_mgmt: As the company continues to grow, don't lose the passion for our customers' success. A big key to that will be continuing to hire people who share our vision and who are a good fit with the company culture.

review_title: This isn't hype, this is history in the making...
pros: One of the best sales & engineering led leadership organisations in the industry, bar few; A solid and relevant product offering, with the strategy and execution to match. I appreciate that some of you reading this will think that as I'm a current employee, that it's likely I'll say positive things; well, rest assured that's not the case, I took this job on a pay cut, because I've not seen this level of product vision, execution and sales capability, since Netscreen, Fortinet, Fireeye, Palo-Alto and Splunk.... The culture is no-nonsense, you work hard, you perform, you give it your all, you'll make it; this business has been built on the ethos of "whatever it takes" and "we're in this together"; it's that drive that has seen the biggest financial and customer acquisition growth, in the pre-IPO market this past decade.
cons: As with the very few vendors who have been through this level of hyper-growth in the past, there will be teething issues across all parts of the organisation, bu rest assured everyone here is a AAA player and performer; we recognise our mistakes early and suffer fools rarely... Be prepared to work harder than you've most likely ever done in your career so far, but in return be prepared to leave a mark in the industry and few will ever match in your life-time...
advice_to_mgmt: Maintain the focus in the key areas that will ensure continued product growth and functionality, continue consider the direction, ideas and strategy input o those in the org that have significant start-up and GTM experience at early stage growth. Trust your gut instinct at C level, whilst we continue to forge a path that few have ever come close to matching.... This is not easy, but then again those who've set records were told it couldn't be done.

pros:
Exciting vision to disrupt an antiquated market
Lots of positive hype around the company
cons:
Low morale across many of the company’s business functions from Customer Success to Professional Services to Sales. The product is very complex and not stable (extremely buggy). Every team is feeling the pain because of this.

In fact, Engineering is slowing product innovation to focus on the quality issues. We are forced to constantly work in firefighting mode. Internal training is cancelled frequently, as support must jump on P1 customer cases due to product failures instead.

Boys club culture at the top level. They brought an inappropriate comedian to a company event that made racist and sexist jokes. It was disappointing to see leadership standing at the front of the room laughing along.

Not the “rocket ship” I was promised.. I hope they are able to turn things around.
advice_to_mgmt: Make the product functional and simpler. You won’t be able to scale with the current product design. It shouldn’t take 10 months to onboard a new hire because they need to learn where all the skeletons and landmines are hidden.

pros:
Lots of Imperva folks
Sales team is growing
Catered lunch on Wednesday
cons:
Dictatorial management
Culture of fear and retaliation
Employees depressed
Daily firefighting
Terrible NPS

pros:
Awesome & friendly coworkers
Unlimited pto
free lunch on Wednesdays
Happy Hour at work on Thursdays
So many yummy snacks
No egos
Great HR team!
Room to grow
They really trust their employees
cons: very fast-paced but it makes time go by quick!

pros:
Free lunch on Wednesday
Happy hour on Thursday
cons:
Churn in Leadership team
Clueless HR
Low morale in Customer Success
Incredibly complex product
Outside sales, below average compensation policies
Sleazy sales - always over promise

pros:
I’ve waited nearly 3 years to write a review about Exabeam.
Exabeam is the most exceptional venture I’ve ever encountered.
People/culture: Smart, high-performing, low-ego, high sense of humor, and 100% integrity and trust. Exabeam is the most radically transparent company I’ve ever come across, and I’ve asked hundreds of candidates whether they've ever heard of a company as open and the answer is always “no.” Not even close.
Exabeam operates at high velocity in every aspect.
Exabeam is highly successful, and success is palpable throughout.
I’ve never dreaded a Monday morning or having to go back to work after vacation.
It always feels great walking into the office.
Moving to a new company is scary because you don’t know what the place is indeed like until you’ve been on board a few months. Rest assured, Exabeam is an excellent place to work.
cons: From my perspective, zero negatives

pros:
If I could write about Exabeam, it probably would be an essay and comparing my previous experiences at other companies. This place feels like I hit the jackpot. I have never been apart of a company with amazing leaders, because of who they are and their values it has affected the culture and people in a very positive way.

This place is very special, there is high transparency, growth opportunities, support, and trust.

There are truly genuinely kind and smart people in the office, it affects you in a very positive way.
cons: Of course there is growing pains, but I see this as a good thing especially at a 5 year old company.
advice_to_mgmt:
Please try your best to maintain what has been created at Exabeam -- culture.

Thank you for trusting in your employees #wintogether

review_title: If you're lucky enough to get the offer, DO NOT HESITATE to join this company.
pros:
Where do I start....?

1. A hi-tech cyber-security startup that brings strong value to it's customers with a product that works out of the box. For sales and sales engineering, it doesn't get any better than this.

2. An approachable senior management team that truly listens to and respects everyone in the company no matter what their position. Even if your suggestion or concern is not agreed with you'll get a thoughtful explanation and treated with respect.

3. Very competitive pay and benefits. A-players are paid accordingly, and I'm a little jealous of those who work out of HQ. The atmosphere there is great every time I visit.

4. Internal office politics are non-existent. We win as a team, we (very seldom) lose as a team. The way this company forms up to support a customer pre-and post-sales is impressive to say the least. Again, all the way to the top.

5. Been in this industry 22 years...rarely can it be said that every member of a Senior Management Team, or Product Management, etc. can be brought to an account with confidence, knowing they'll bring value to the customer.

6. A true family atmosphere.

7. Sworn to secrecy on the numbers...but lets just say "Explosive Growth"! It's pretty darn impressive.
cons: Not a con, just a warning. This is FAST MOVING, high growth company. There's no place to hide, and you will work hard here. The good news is, you'll be paid well, you'll enjoy it, and the end goal will all make it worthwhile.

pros:
- Incredibly fast paced.
- Outstanding team that works together.
- The entire team comes together to ensure our customers are successful.
- Leadership has a vision that they consistently execute on.
- Everyone wants to win and succeed.
cons: Not anything significant. This is my third start-up and there’s never been anything that I didn’t expect.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep going down the same path. The leadership has been amazing.

pros: Great product with a lot of momentum. Company is growing 100% plus a year
cons: Have yet to fine one

review_title: The most rewarding place to work
pros:
Fast pace. Lots to learn.
Many smart people to work with.
Company's sales record has been unstoppable. Exciting outlook.
Top performer recognized and rewarded repeatedly.
cons: None I can think of.

pros: This company will be the next big name in enterprise security. Incredible executive team - vision, execution, no ego culture. They have the DNA, the drive and the right people to make it happen. Everyone here is sprinting in the same direction and knocking down anything in their way. Market opportunity is enormous.
cons: Going after big established players that will not just roll over and die. We have to take it from them. You have to be passionate to help customers cut through all the noise.
advice_to_mgmt: None. Keep on doing the same things.

pros:
Lots of hard-working and autonomous people in every org, huge emphasis on transparency & results. Leadership has a laser-like focus on company goals and their can-do attitude is infectious. Every team has high willingness to go 'all hands on deck' for top priority projects. Very fast-paced and lots of work to be done but most people are still able to retain a good work/life balance (lots of employees with family at home). Culture is 'silicon valley startup' without being ridiculous, which is a hard balance to achieve.

Tons of smart people in engineering with a variety of backgrounds. Can learn something new every day (front end, data science, backend, devops, all within 200 feet of each other).

One unique attribute - huge emphasis on product design, which is leaps and bounds ahead of most enterprise software I've used and worked on.

Highly recommend Exabeam to engineers who want to hit the ground running & make an immediate impact.
cons: Location is somehow super central yet still far from where everyone actually lives :) This seems like a bay area problem, though. Otherwise, not much to complain about. There is always a lot of work to do - this could be a bad thing if you can't keep up with the pace.
advice_to_mgmt:
Keep on hiring talented, hard-working folks. As the company grows with the new products, it will be harder and harder to bring the right people aboard. Also, don't be afraid to emphasize quality over time-to-market in certain key areas of the product.

Also, make sure to keep elevating hard-working people within the org and rewarding them with new opportunities/advancement.

review_title: Amazing Company - Taking off like a rocket ship
pros:
- a very high density of rock stars
- Killer products and a great team
- Their market is large and primed for disruption
- A really fun place to work
cons: If you don't like fast paced work environments this isn't going to be for you. It's a fun work environment, but not a place you can "rest and vest".
advice_to_mgmt: None. Keep doing what you're doing!

pros:
Product just works & customers are regualrly praising product to vendors & peers
Teamwork throughout with the goal to do what's best for customer
Complete transparency from the Executive team on down
cons: If you don't like to have fun & work hard then this place is not for you?

pros: I recently joined and can honestly say that this was a fantastic decision on my part (not to toot my own horn or anything). The leaders are approachable, down to earth and wicked smart. The people in the company are so nice - its almost unbelievable. People welcomed me continuously and worked to make me feel included in our weekly HQ events. The product is doing extremely well and there is an awesome vibe among everyone whether they are remote or at HQ. The transparency is fantastic and this is just a great place to be because you're challenged and working alongside rock stars.
cons: This isn't a "con" by any stretch but there is a lot of work. This startup runs at a hyper speed. There is no room to hide so accountability is at the forefront.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing. It is working. Really excited to be a part of the Exabeam family!

review_title: Best Company I've Ever Been A Part Of
pros: Willingness to always support our customers! Best UBA product on the market today! Great Customers! Great Federal Government Customers! Forward looking! Seasoned CxO team leading company - will roll their sleeves up to help!
cons: Since this field has a 20 character minimum - nothing really comes to mind.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up! We are truly building something unique, necessary and impactful!

pros: This company, which sits at a nice office in San Mateo, has build and is currently building a phenomenal product for the user behavioral analytics space. Everyone on the team works together, and you can see the amazing work our engineers, sales, and technical account managers do. The synergy we have makes the work environment a pleasure to be in, and the work we do makes the effort worth it. It's hard work, but it's also rewarding!
cons: No cons whatsoever, no matter what position you have at Exabeam, you're sure to enjoy it!

pros:
As long as I've been at Exabeam, there has been no catch. It's just been working with smart people who are good at what they do and good to be around, working on building products and a business growing very fast.
Pros included:
-Professional/experienced staff and management
-Low ego attitude
-Fast growing market
-Solid product
-Happy Hrs
-Wednesday Lunches
-Friendly atmosphere
cons: Can't think of any cons - unless you list things like everyone is super busy

pros:
* People are easy to work with and smart
* Free food Wednesdays
* Snacks, drinks, etc
* CEO is extremely open, we know exactly where the company is going
* Product is extremely well designed and runs great, especially for its age
* Due to the nature of the product, not many instances of "OMG THIS BROKE, THE WORLD IS ENDING, MUST FIX OVER WEEKEND AND LOSE WEEKEND"
cons:
* Product is young and missing some features
* Location - noone seems to be central to San Mateo
advice_to_mgmt: Keep going with the open communication, and keep the organization flat as we grow.

pros:
- Cutting-edge technology
- Healthy culture
- Hard but very rewarding work
- A company that lives up to its values
- Approachable and respectful management
cons: Nothing comes to my mind

pros: Hopefully everyone has an opportunity in their career to work for a company like Exabeam. The culture here is amazing, the people are extraordinary and upper management is first class. Everyone supports each other and the level of respect for each other is amazing.
cons: I seriously cannot think of anything negative
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing...it's an honour to work for a company with such great integrity

pros:
- 4 months into the job after very nearly joining a competitor and i'm very pleased (and relieved) with my decision.

- Exabeam prides itself on the whole team being a 'family' and it very much feels like that. Everyone is working together towards a common goal and the whole family are incredibly supportive to one-another.

- The technology is amazing and is making a huge impact for our customers. Releases are frequent and the roadmap is very exciting. Customers love what Exabeam has to offer and it's hugely disruptive.

- We're growing rapidly but not falling down the trap of other vendors who scale their sales teams too quickly.

- Agile and very transparent. If you need any help whatsoever you're encouraged to ask.
cons: - None. This is my 1st true start up and i've seen none of the usual teething problems typically associated with this level of early stage growth.
advice_to_mgmt: - Do as much as you can to maintain that 'family' feel and connection with HQ as we continue to grow. That culture is infectious.

review_title: Awesome Product, Awesome Leadership, Great Place to be
pros: Working in Security a long time, this is the most exciting, most current, and innovative product in the security market today. Helping my customers make a real difference to the threats they face. the company is extremely supportive and fantastic culture. Leadership team are supportive, helpful and hands on throughout.
cons: Working here almost a year I cannot see any, the best place I have worked.
